course: Introduction to Data Science with Beginning R and Python

scenario.title: Junior Business Analyst
scenario.description: Maya is a junior business analyst at a midsized tech-enabled company. She increasingly needs to analyze large datasets but feels limited by Excel. She wants beginner-friendly R and Python skills to improve performance and position herself for a promotion into a data-focused role.

expectations: Structured, beginner-accessible instruction with practical assignments she can apply to work, clear pacing guidance, and responsive support (office hours, TA help).

actions: Scans job postings requiring Python and R.
Reviews NC State Continuing Education program pages.
Watches a short overview video and skims FAQs.
pains: Overwhelmed by numerous beginner data science options.
Uncertainty about which course level matches her skills.

feelings.quote: I need the right first step so I don’t get overwhelmed.

opportunities: Clearly label the course as beginner-friendly and career-relevant.
Provide a simple ‘Is this course right for me?’ checklist.

actions: Compares syllabus to bootcamps and LinkedIn Learning.
Checks weekly time commitment and sample assignments.
Looks for testimonials from working professionals.
pains: Concern about balancing workload with full-time job.
Anxiety about pace and coding difficulty.

feelings.quote: I can manage this if the structure is clear.

opportunities: Publish transparent workload and pacing guidance.
Showcase work-friendly success stories and example projects.

actions: Submits tuition reimbursement paperwork to employer.
pains: Employer approval and HR documentation feel tedious.
Nervous about cost and proving ROI.

feelings.quote: This is an investment—I need to make it count.

opportunities: Provide employer-facing outcome summaries and skills mapping.
Offer clear receipts, completion letters, and timelines for reimbursement.

actions: Attends live/virtual sessions and reviews recordings.
Seeks help in forums and office hours.
pains: Time pressure when work gets busy.

feelings.quote: This is challenging, but I can see my progress.

opportunities: Provide annotated code walkthroughs and quick-reference cheatsheets.
Facilitate peer study groups and TA office hours.
